post.file:
#!/bin/sh
LOCAL_DIR=/var/opt/condor rm -fr $LOCAL_DIR mkdir -p $LOCAL_DIR
chown -R condor.condor $LOCAL_DIR
if [ -f /etc/profile.d/java.sh ]; then . /etc/profile.d/java.sh fi . /etc/profile.d/rocks-condor.sh cd $CONDOR_ROOT $CONDOR_ROOT/sbin/CondorConf -n compute -t se -m &Condor_Master; --localdomain=&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain;
cat >> /opt/condor/etc/condor_config.local << 'CONFEOF' # First set JAVA_MAXHEAP_ARGUMENT to null, to disable the default of max RAM JAVA_MAXHEAP_ARGUMENT = # Now set the argument with the Sun-specific maximum allowable value CONFEOF
export localmem=`/usr/bin/free -m | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}'` if [ $localmem -gt 1906 ] ; then localmem=1906 fi echo "JAVA_EXTRA_ARGUMENTS = -Xmx${localmem}m" >> /opt/condor/etc/condor_config.local
condorNet='' if [ "x&Condor_ClientNetwork;" != "x" ]; then condorNet=/opt/rocks/bin/rocks list host interface &hostname; | grep $Condor_ClientNetwork 2> /dev/null | /bin/awk '{printf "%s",$4}' | tr -d '-' fi
if [ "x$condorNet" != "x" ]; then /bin/sed -i '/NETWORK_INTERFACE/d' /opt/condor/etc/condor_config.local echo "NETWORK_INTERFACE = $condorNet" >> /opt/condor/etc/condor_config.local fi
